meanings.definition: To dislike or have a lack of taste for something.
meanings.sent1: She was disrelishing the new vegetable dish at dinner.
meanings.sent2: I find myself disrelishing the idea of going to the dentist.
meanings.sent3: Even the dog was disrelishing the strange smell coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her face showed clear signs of disrelishing the bitter news.
meanings.sent5: The child's wrinkled nose indicated he was disrelishing the unfamiliar food.

meanings.definition: To feel aversion or distaste towards something.
meanings.sent1: He was disrelishing the thought of having to clean the messy room.
meanings.sent2: The cat was disrelishing the taste of the medicine in its food.
meanings.sent3: The movie character comically kept disrelishing the idea of exercise.
meanings.sent4: She found herself disrelishing the sound of nails on a chalkboard.
meanings.sent5: The student's face clearly showed he was disrelishing the idea of a pop quiz.
